title: Amazon introduces new Echo devices, Alexa features and a smart oven
text: Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +1.53% unveiled a slew of new devices and features at a Wednesday event, including a smart oven. Amazon has eight new Echo devices coming, including the Echo Flex, a wireless plug-in smart speaker, priced at $24.99, the Echo Show 8 with an eight-inch display, priced at $199.99, and the Echo Studio with improved speakers, priced at $199.99. Amazon is also launching new wifi systems, the Eero and Eero Pro, that start at $99. These items will be on sale in the U.S. on Wednesday and will be available in France, Germany and other parts of Europe in early November. Customers that participate in the Day 1 Editions program, which brings new items to customers faster, will also have access to Echo Frames, Alexa-equipped glasses, for $179.99, and the Echo Loop, a smart ring, with a $129.99 price tag. For the home, Amazon has a new Amazon Smart Oven that's voice controlled and is a combined air fryer, convection oven, microwave and food warmer, priced at $249.99. There's also a smart lamp, the Echo Glow, that's Alexa enabled and priced at $29.99. And there are new safety features, like Alexa Guard that sends alerts when there are sounds of glass breaking or smoke alarms while the owner is away. A new program, Certified for Humans, will help customers choose products that are easy to set up and work with Alexa. These items will be from brands other than Amazon. Amazon stock is up 17.5% for the year to date while the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.62% is up 19% for the period.
